Steps to reproduce:

Visit gmail

No crash.

comments.text:
image.mem.decodeondraw;true is causing the crash in gmail.
Setting it back to false is a workaround.
comments.raw_text:
image.mem.decodeondraw;true is causing the crash in gmail.
Setting it back to false is a workaround.

comments.creator: a2414578@nepwk.com
comments.author: a2414578@nepwk.com
comments.text: WFM now, ty. Close this bug as a dupe of bug 682568.
comments.raw_text: WFM now, ty. Close this bug as a dupe of bug 682568.

js::Interpret(JSContext*, js::StackFrame*, js::InterpMode) still shows up in crash stats up to the trunk version with 1,251 Crash Reports across all versions. The patch in Bug 682568 landed at the end of August and this signature still persists, so there must be other root causes of the crash in this signature.

> It's #99 top browser crasher in 13.0.1, #91 in 14.0b7, #22 in 15.0a2 and #16
> in 16.0a1.

This feels like we should pull some new correlations, since it feels like this could be developer related. Since this is a bucket meta bug, we likely will untrack if that doesn't turn anything up.

comments.text:
(In reply to Alex Keybl [:akeybl] from comment #10)
> This feels like we should pull some new correlations, since it feels like
> this could be developer related.
As correlations are daily and not weekly, they are based on only 20 crashes in 15.0a2:
25% (5/20) vs.   3% (193/6967) firebug@software.joehewitt.com (Firebug, https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/1843)
     15% (3/20) vs.   4% (255/6967) {e4a8a97b-f2ed-450b-b12d-ee082ba24781} (Greasemonkey, https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/748)
comments.author: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.creator: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Alex Keybl [:akeybl] from comment #10)
> This feels like we should pull some new correlations, since it feels like
> this could be developer related.
As correlations are daily and not weekly, they are based on only 20 crashes in 15.0a2:
25% (5/20) vs.   3% (193/6967) firebug@software.joehewitt.com (Firebug, https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/1843)
     15% (3/20) vs.   4% (255/6967) {e4a8a97b-f2ed-450b-b12d-ee082ba24781} (Greasemonkey, https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/748)

On Aurora, these are mostly actually crashing in jitcode. We've never been able to get anywhere on those crashes without STR. There is also not much JS at all in the regression range. Nick, I see that you did land a few patches there. Does anything jump out at you as possibly related to crashes in Firebug/Greasemonkey, or should we just untrack?

comments.creator: n.nethercote@gmail.com
comments.text:
> Nick, I see that you did land a few patches
> there. Does anything jump out at you as possibly related to crashes in
> Firebug/Greasemonkey

No.  My four changes in the range from comment 9 were all innocuous refactorings, and are unlikely to have caused a crash in js::Interpret().

comments.raw_text: Hmmm, I see scopes in the new regression range. See anything, Luke?
comments.creator: dmandelin@mozilla.com
comments.text: Hmmm, I see scopes in the new regression range. See anything, Luke?
comments.author: dmandelin@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: There was indeed a spike probably caused by the scope stuff (along with quite a few other topcrashes at the same time), but it died down a few days later when the fixes landed (along with all the other known topcrashes).  The current crash rate is non-zero, but it seems commensurate with the day before the spike.
comments.text: There was indeed a spike probably caused by the scope stuff (along with quite a few other topcrashes at the same time), but it died down a few days later when the fixes landed (along with all the other known topcrashes).  The current crash rate is non-zero, but it seems commensurate with the day before the spike.
